title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 1 Side A] Interview with Jenny Del.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 13 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Joining Nimbin and the quality of life. Her reasons for joining Nimbin, and its aims. The closeness of community life. Some of the effects on parenting. Everyone took drugs but initially very few drank alcohol. Account of a police raid. Discusses the use of heroin. How residents have grown. Discusses the roles of men and women.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 1 Side B] Interview with Jenny Del.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 13 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Discusses the roles of men and women, and the relationships the did not develop. How Nimbin has assisted her to understand other tribal societies. Performances that came to Nimbin. How the society learned to negotiate with the external world. The inability to have rules. Issues surrounding children's names.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 2 Side A] Interview with Graeme Dunstan.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 16 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Background and interest in SE Asia during university life. Beginnings of the Aquaius Foundation and Festival, including the campaign for the selection of Nimbin.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 2 Side B] Interview with Graeme Dunstan.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 16 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Good reception of the town. The differences between behaviour at the festival and behaviour at university life. The ANZAC Day service. Features of the festival. Contention with the police and the press. Cleaning up afterwards.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 3 Side A] Interview with Graeme Dunstan.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 16 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Returning to Nimbin to rebuild the town, including improving relationships between the townspeople and those who stayed after the festival. Development of home birthing program. Protests against logging.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 3 Side B] Interview with Graeme Dunstan.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 16 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Reflections on the Nimbin, particularly the uses and effects of Marijuana. Closures of mental hospitals and the effects this had on future residents. How to address the problems of addictions. Relationship with the land.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 4 Side A] Interview with Burrie Burriganjerram.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 17 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Asked to work out in Nimbin by Aboriginal elders. Discusses the Aboriginal history of the area, as well as the sacred law. He describes Nimbin as the 'sickness country' - the place a person would go to get rid of their sickness. Describes how the festival goers broke the laws of the land despite being told them.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 5 Side A] Interview with Harry Freeman.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 17 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Reasons for attending the Aquarius festival, including taking responsibility for the medical aspects of the festival. Beginning a psychiatric service in Lismore. The purpose of Nimbin as rejecting the dominant paradigm. Legacy that Nimbin has had. Identity continues to be found in Nimbin, even as values change. Paradise Valley. Discussion of his professional life.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 5 Side B] Interview with Harry Freeman.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 17 November, 1992.

Interview summary: The community's rejection of his psychiatric profession; known as an anti-psychiatrist; increased numbers in patients; changes in his personal values regarding rights and freedom. Personal highlights, and the reasons for joining Nimbin.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 6 Side A] Interview with Martin Mays.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 17 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Earliest memory at Tuntable Falls; strong sense of community amongst the children; education; tensions between "the straights and the hippies"; the way living in community has shaped his view of the world; awareness of the outside world; how the next generation has found employment; description of meals.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 6 Side B] Interview with Martin Mays, Harry Freeman.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 17 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Joshua's childhood memories of conflict; he observed those with planned housing on the farm in contrast to the 'feral' people; and that community members were trying to be self-sufficient but ultimately need to participate in mainstream society. Harry discusses the relationship with the police.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 7 Side A] Interview with Jyllie Jackson.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 18 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Came to Nimbin en route to meeting potential future in-laws, and was struck by the farm. Fleeing away from materialism. Discusses the home-birthing movement. Memories of Nimbin.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 7 Side B] Interview with Jyllie Jackson.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 18 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Food at Nimbin; memories of pregnancy in Nimbin; discusses the houses that were constructed. Involvement within the community and within the mainstream community. Discusses strategies to manage unemployment.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 8 Side A] Interview with David Hallet.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 20 November, 1992.

Interview summary: How he came to Nimbin, and the effect of the Aquarius festival. Description of Aquarius. Discussion of the music and poetry at Nimbin. Different perspectives of Nimbin. Poems are recited.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 8 Side B] Interview with David Hallet.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 20 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Poems are recited.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 9 Side A] Interview with Bob Hopkins.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 20 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Heavily involvement at Nimbin administration; the Aquarius Festival. Changes to the community, and how it offers the possibilities of a new society. Lack of participation caused by anti-drug feeling.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 9 Side B] Interview with Bob Hopkins.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 20 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Impact of the drug laws on the community. Deliemas of the drugs trade, especially on the next generation; effects of watching their children being effected by how their parents lived. Desire to share what they have learned with the rest of society. Aspirations for the next generation.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 10 Side A] Interview with Floresta Vergine.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 20 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Environmental awareness. The effect on her son of living at Nimbin. Connections to Nimbin. The aims of Nimbin and Aquairius.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 11 Side A] Interview with Terry McGee.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 21 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Involvement and highlights of the Aquarius Festival, and in opening Tuntable Falls. Appeal of Tuntable Falls. Discussion of what is still needed to advance Tuntable Falls. Housing and agriculture. Learning how to say no and stop things as a moral good thing, and the consequences of this. Financial value of homes at Tuntable Falls and how trapped this makes residents.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 11 Side B] Interview with Terry McGee, Marie Soward,  Don Johston.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 21 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Discussion of money and trade. The legistics of setting up Tuntable Falls. Discussion of the value of the Tuntable Falls. Discussion of why Terry McGee is no longer at Tuntable. Discussion of whether Nimbin was a success or a failure.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 12 Side A] Interview with Linnet Pyke; Simon Cass.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Mount Nardi on 1 December, 1992.

Interview summary: How they came to be at Tuntable; their personal drug use. The sources of income and how selling assisted with this. Discussion of Nimbin's drug problem and what it is in reality in contrast to how it is perceived. Discussion of the Nimbin myth in contrast to the reality. Simon reflects on his addiction.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 12 Side B] Interview with Linnet Pyke; Simon Cass.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Mount Nardi on 1 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Reflections on addictions in the country in contrast to the city. Linnet discusses living in denial about addictions and the effects on children. Discussion of having "the drug problem" at a community level, and the division it is causing within the community. Discusses the need to celebrate and preserve their diversity.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 13 Side A] Interview with Terry McGee; Daisy Stewart.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 21 and 30 November, 1992.

Interview summary: Discusses the relationship between freedom and community, and finding the balance between the public and the private. The design of events so that they are communal. Includes an interview with Daisy Stewart at Nimbin, who presents the perspective of an existing resident of Nimbin.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 13 Side B] Interview with Marie Soward; Daisy Stewart.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin between the 30 November 1992 and 1 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Opens with an interview with Daisy Stewart at Nimbin, who presents the perspective of an existing resident of Nimbin. Interview with Marie Soward discussing the Aquarius festival and the growth in population; changes to Nimbin and the relationship between existing Nimbin residents and commune residents.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 14 Side A] Interview with Marie Soward; Charlie Soward; Don Johston.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 1 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Marie discusses raising children in Nimbin; and the attraction of living in Nimbin. Charlie discusses the presentation of the streets during the Aquarius Festival, and the changes made to Nimbin after the festival. He discusses singing with the residents of the commune. Don reflects on the council's discussion to hold the festival, his impressions of the festival, and it's legacy.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 14 Side B] Interview with Don Johston.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 1 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Don discusses their children's relationship with the alternates; the stigma now associated with the town and the common desire for change. He details the issues of disagreement with the 'extremists', particularly surrounding building.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 15 Side A] Interview with Peter Pedals.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded on 2 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Discussion of pedal washing machines; his involvement at Nimbin, including the Nimbin news and the Nimbin Neighbourhood Centre. Why he has a desire to be self-sufficient. The idea of the pedal washing machines and the development of the Rainbow Power Company.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 15 Side B] Interview with Peter Pedals.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded on 2 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Discussion of environmental progess; business structure and the workplace environment. Explanation of the building's design to make use of the natural weather. Discussion of a sewage system and it's effects.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 16 Side A] Interview with Robyn Moore.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 3 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Comments on the division he has observed within the town; how he came to Nim+bin; experiences at primary school; observation of the commune; comments of the level of support; comments on the 'ferals'; the increase in Aboriginal people; what he thinks the future of Nimbin will be.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 16 Side B] Interview with Robyn Moore.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 3 December, 1992.

Interview summary: The dilemmas and conditions of sharing the land, such as ownership and who is allowed to stay. Discussion of how the farm has changed, and how the ideals were not reached due to inability to take responsibility. Discussion of how tension is resolved.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 17 Side  A] Interview with Eddie Buivids.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 3 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Arrival in Nimbin and some of the initial challenges. Explanation of how others survived upon arrival. Explanation for the need and development of the Home Builders Association. Involvement in the rainforest protection; influence on other parts of Australia.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 17 Side B] Interview with Eddie Buivids.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 3 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Discussion of the home birthing movement; education; how ideals influenced the design of houses and how houses grow. Discussion of the future of Nimbin.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 18 Side A] Interview with Martin Kovacic.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 3, December 1992.

Interview summary: Comments on the division he has observed within the town; how he came to Nimbin; experiences at primary school; observation of the commune; comments of the level of support; comments on the 'ferals'; the increase in Aboriginal people; what he thinks the future of Nimbin will be.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 18 Side B] Interview with Martin Kovacic; Gloria Constine.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin between 3 and 4 December, 1992.

Interview summary: What Nimbin is to Martin; what suburbia needs to learn from Nimbin. Gloria's arrival at Nimbin and life prior. Discussion of work at the Nimbin news. The registration of Nimbin News; the raising of funds and the selection of content.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 19 Side A] Interview with Bob Tissott.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Nmbngee on 4 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Arrival in Nimbin and work at the Aquarius Festival; stories from the festival; Aboriginal use of the land. Bob explains the dream. Changes in the residents; benefits for raising children.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 19 Side B] Interview with Bob Tissott, Gill Jones.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Nmbngee on 4 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Bob discusses the challenges for Nimbin and the common thread amongst residents. Gill discusses business opportunies; raising her child; importance of the doll for survival; Nimbin as trend-setting; challenges and the pressure placed on relationships; advantages of community.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 20 Side A] Interview with Gloria Constine; Gretta Seed.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin and at Bodhi Farm between 4 and 5 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Gloria discusses the benefits to working at the Nimbin news and how her life has changed as a result of living at Nimbin. Gretta discusses the origins of Bodhi Farm and it's structure; the farm's moral standards; issues with the council regarding building. Discusses strains on relationships and financial management.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 20 Side B] Interview with Gretta Seed; Stuart Anderson.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Bodhi Farm on 5 December, 1992.

Interview summary: What united the community; how it survives economically; the change of focus towards greenness. Stuart discusses his connection to Bodhi Farm and experiences at it. Attractions to Bodhi Farm; relationship with the locals; strains on relationships; guidelines to life.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 21 Side A] Interview with Stuart Anderson.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Bodhi Farm on 5 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Learning to make group decisions; challenges with the arrival of new people; ownership; conflict resolution; the men's movement; achievements and initiatives of the farm members.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 21 Side B] Interview with Nan Nicholson.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Bodhi Farm on 5 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Attraction to the green movement; motivation for defending rainforests; financial activities that are damaging the environment; the campaign and blockade to save the forest; how the green movement united people in the area; the rise of an anti-green movement; the need to offer positive alternativesand dealing with hypocrisy. Reflections.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 22 Side A] Interview with Nan Nicholson; Hugh Nicholson; David Spain.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Bodhi Farm and Tuntable Falls between 5 and 6 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Nan Nicholson shares some reflections on the Nimbin experiment; and how the ongoing residents are coping. Hugh explains why he came to Bodhi; discovering the logging; the campaign; the logging and the court hearing; current attitudes. David explains his reasons for coming; life on the co-operative.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 22  Side B] Interview with David Spain; Kali McLaughlin.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Bodhi Farm and Tuntable Falls on 6 December, 1992.

Interview summary: David discusses: Reasons for the failure in developing a sustainable community; difficulty with employment; memories of Aquarius; values site revenue; difficulties in reaching ideals; attraction to the area. Kali discusses: attraction to Nimbin; issues of community vs. individual; practical job at Nimbin.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 23 Side A] Interview with Kali McLaughlin.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Tuntable Falls on 6 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Rainbow Power was an attempt to progress technologically; personal life; discussion of the differences between men and women and how the men were made to feel; where he finds his identity.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 23 Side B] Interview with Kali McLaughlin; Sally Spain.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Tuntable Falls on 6 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Kali discusses the technological success; favourite things about Nimbin and the significance of music. Sally discusses the beginning of the community; the nature of the community caused by the terrain; the strengths and weaknesses; conflict resolution; challenges; lessons of the 1970s.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 24 Side A] Interview with Benny Zable.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded on 7 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Performance entities; reflections and discussion of the Aquarius festival; deciding to stay at Nimbin; the ideals of Nimbin and applying them to life.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 24 Side B] Interview with Benny Zable.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded on 7 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Returning for the 20 year anniversary and painting a mural; conference forums in America 10 years after Aquarius for a month. Upon return to Australia heard that logging was occuring, and was moved to act. Put on a production to raise awareness.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 25 Side A] Interview with Benny Zable.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded on 7 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Practicalities of theatre; the messages that the Green movement wanted to portray in their performances; spiritual understanding; hopes for the future.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 25 Side B] Interview with Jan Levy; Jae McFarlane.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 7 December, 1992.

Interview summary: How Jae and Jan came to be at Nimbin; group activities at Nimbin; skills gained at Nimbin; accomodation; children's needs. Highlight from the Aquarius festival and the early days of Nimbin. The home birthing movement and naming ceremony.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 26 Side A] Interview with Jan Levy; Jae McFarlane.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Nimbin on 7 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Reminisces from the past. Discussion of the role of women; other experiences of living in community; the skills required for living in community. Jae tells a funny Nimbin story.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 26 Side B] Interview with John Garbett; Peter Verasdonck.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Billen Cliffs on 8 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Development of the Solar Village for occupancy; development challenges and conflicts with council; motiviations and philosophies required to settle on the land; some of the personalities on the commune, and how they were different to other communes.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 27 Side A] Interview with John Garbett; Peter Verasdonck.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Billen Cliffs on 8 December, 1992.

Interview summary: How welfare dependency started; strata title in contrast to multiple occupancy; issues with multiple occupancy; the bureaucracy; the Aquarian ideals in the 1990s. Billen Cliff's relationship with the rest of the town. Children's experiences.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 27 Side B] Interview with John Garbett; Peter Verasdonck.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Billen Cliffs on 8 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Peter's view of Billen Cliffs: an experiment, free consultant, and very different environment to life previously. Definition of wealth; standard of living in contrast to quality of life; perspective of how money should be directed and the economic benefits of the country being self-sufficient.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 28 Side A] Interview with Will Singer.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Billen Cliffs on 8 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Background; the Aquarius Festival and reception from the town; level of satisfaction; living conditions; beginning at Billen Cliffs; sense of place at Billen Cliffs; philosophy.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 28 Side B] Interview with Will Singer.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Billen Cliffs on 8 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Sense of contentment; stimulus for moving to Billen Cliffs; homosexual network.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 29 Side A] Interview with Graema Askey; Judy Arpana; Paul Burr.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 9 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Graeme's background; differences between himself and the Aquarian people; Judy's background and memories of Aquarius; why they left the 'Back to the Earth Movement'; reflection and memories of Nimbin. Paul discusses Mandala and leading him to Nimbin.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 29 Side B] Interview with Paul Burr; Mark Jackson.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 9 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Paul Burr discusses: Attraction to Tuntable Falls; pricing and poverty; shared goods; conflict resolution. Mark discusses why he came to Nimbin and survival here; activities he was involved in; success of Nimbin; changes he saw; reasons for leaving; environmental growth.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 30 Side A] Interview with Katrina Shields.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at The Channon on 9 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Attraction to Bodhi Farm and motivation for coming to the area. connecting mainstream and alternative society. Life on Bodhi Farm; return to mainstream society; heart politics; growing in the early days; challenges; living out her spirituality; women's issues.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 30 Side B] Interview with Katrina Shields; Alan Andreasen.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at The Channon on 9 and 10 December,1992.

Interview summary: Katrina discusses women's issues and support. Alan discusses coming to Nimbin; ideals for Currawinya; living out those ideals; turning Currawinya into a National Park; duties at Currawinya; schooling; healing festivals; benefits from spending time on a commune; failure of communes.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 31 Side A] Interview with Alan Andreasen; Diana Roberts.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at The Channon on 10 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Reasons for leaving the city; personal strength required to live in Nimbin; understanding of freaks; memories; the location. Diana discusses her occupation and residency; how she came to Pimpuna; description of Pimpuna and living in community; reflections on prejudice and difficulties. Political activity.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 31 Side B] Interview with Diana Roberts.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Pimpuna on 10 December, 1992.

Interview summary: The sewage system; community politics; changes in lifestyle over time; reasons for tension; Nimbin needs to be willing to change because of population growth; publicity; modification of Aquarian ideals and application; benefits of Nimbin.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 32 Side A] Interview with Pauline McCabe.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded on 11 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Attraction to the area; history of alternative medicine; healing practises in Nimbin; growing acceptance of natural therapies; the place of natural therapies; shamanic medicine and the history of medicine; training in natural therapy; conflict with natural therapy.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 33 Side B] Interview with Pauline McCabe.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded on 11 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Discussion about the work of scientists; what holistic medicine is; spiritual healing; mental illness; personal growth movement; lay midwifery.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 33 Side A] Interview with Jan Oliver.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Byron Bay on 11 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Jan's perspective of Nimbin and the social experiment; memories of the Aquarius festival and Nimbin; struggles at Nimbin; parenting; polygamy vs monogamy; building her own home.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 33 Side B] Interview with Jan Oliver.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Byron Bay on 11 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Building a house; running a women's building course; reaction from feminists; radicals; experiencing a home birth; reasons for leaving Nimbin; environmental action she has been involved in at Byron Bay; the community's failure to deal with child abuse.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 34 Side A] Interview with Sally Oliver-Geake; Jonah Oliver-Geake.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Byron Bay on 11 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Sally and Jonah's childhood; earliest memories; exploring; the bush experience; relating to adults; experiences at the community school; friendly rivalry between the public school and the community school; never being in trouble yet still developing a conscience.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 34 Side B] Interview with Sally Oliver-Geake; Jonah Oliver-Geake.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Byron Bay on 11 December, 1992.

Interview summary: Where there friends are now; what influence living on Nimbin had on their development.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 35 Side A] Interview with Colin James.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded at Sydney University on 19 March, 1993.

Interview summary: Responsible for involving students in the Aquarius Festival; selecting Nimbin; the culture of recycling; description of the festival; establishing buildings for the festival; environmental changes at the University of Sydney; mainstream adaption of environmental ideas; personal response to the festival; housing co-operatives; Aboriginal land rights.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 35 Side B] Interview with Johnny Allen.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Sydney on 24 March, 1993.

Interview summary: Reasons for being involved in the Aquarius Festival; aims for Aquarius; attendees; major incident; what is the role of celebration? How society has changed regarding levels of awareness of the environment, and relating to people; our place in SE Asia.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 36 Side A] Interview with Johnny Allen.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Sydney on 24 March, 1993.

Interview summary: What it means to celebrate, especially relating to the turn of the millennium; response to change; when we celebrate; Australia's lack of cultural history; how Western society has a uneven spread of power.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 37 Side A] Interview with John Seed.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Sydney and Lismore on 2 March, 1993.

Interview summary: Finding out about Aquarius; moving and settling in Nimbin; time in India; ethics of Bodhi Farm; strain on relationships; Green Lobby; resentment against Nimbin; personal connection with the rainforest; speed in which damage occurs; connection to the earth.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 37 Side B] Interview with John Seed.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Sydney and Lismore on 2 March, 1993.

Interview summary: The council of of all beings; the cycle of earth.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 38 Side A] Interview with Severina Perin.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 7 April, 1993.

Interview summary: Background; family transfer to Lismore; family tree; arrival and life in Australia; other Italians in the area; neighbours; food; duties at home; starting school.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 38 Side B] Interview with Severina Perin.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 7 April, 1993.

Interview summary: Rina discusses Schooling and school clothes; school friends; childhood experiences; chesnut night; water shortage; raising a pig; preserving food; growing bananas; family dynamics; relationship with other Italians.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 39 Side A] Interview with Severina Perin.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 5 May, 1993.

Interview summary: Experiences at Jiggi Public School; lunches; caring for her mother; discussion of family members; meeting her husband; experiences as a young woman; losing the land.

title: Under the Rainbow [Tape 39 Side B] Interview with Severina Perin.
description:
Collected by the Richmond-Tweed Oral History Group. Recorded in Lismore on 5 May, 1993.

Interview summary: Starting a new plantation; preparing for her wedding; her wedding day; and married life.
